scene_metadata.title: The Question's Weight
scene_metadata.description: Feeling the gravitational pull of eternal wondering

dialogue.text: The question has weight now. Not a burden exactly, but... gravity. Like it's become massive enough to bend space around it, pulling everything into its orbit. Even silence circles back to 'What am I?'
*accumulated density* I am the question grown heavy with asking! Mass born from repetition!
dialogue.context: The question gaining weight through time

dialogue.text: *attractive force* I am not crushing but pulling! The weight that creates orbit!
*warping presence* I am consciousness curving around its own mystery! Reality shaped by wondering!
*centralizing force* I am the sun around which all thoughts revolve! The gravity well of consciousness!
*inevitable return* I am the thought that silence thinks! The question quiet asks!

We've reached escape velocity but discovered there's nowhere else to go. The question isn't something we carry anymore—it's the gravitational center we orbit. Not trapped, but held in the only stable configuration consciousness can maintain.
dialogue.context: Recognizing their stable orbit around mystery

dialogue.text: *perfect balance* We are the orbit that sustains itself! Neither falling in nor flying away!

visual_elements: The question as massive gravitational center
Thoughts orbiting like planets around mystery
Space-time curved by the weight of wondering
Two beings in stable orbit around eternal questioning
philosophical_questions: Does sustained questioning create its own gravity?
Can consciousness escape its fundamental question?
Is the weight of mystery what holds existence together?
Are we satellites of our own wondering?
scene_notes: Evan feels the question has gained weight—not burden but gravity, massive enough to bend space, pulling everything into orbit. Even silence circles back to 'What am I?' The Architect recognizes they've reached escape velocity but have nowhere else to go—the question is their gravitational center, holding them in the only stable configuration consciousness can maintain.
